summary: The No Budget, No Pay Act mandates that members of Congress will not receive pay if Congress fails to pass a concurrent budget resolution and regular appropriations bills by October 1st of each fiscal year. The bill defines key terms like 'Budget and Appropriations Chairs' and 'Member of Congress' and outlines the determination process for non-compliance, handled separately by the House and Senate Budget and Appropriations Chairs. The Act includes no retroactive pay for periods of non-compliance and it will take effect on September 29, 2027.
